title: Ukraine war: One Russian's anti-war protest on the side of his shopping centre
description: Dmitry Skurikhin has listed the Ukrainian towns attacked by Russia on the side of his shopping centre.

title: North Korea: Fighting Covid with traditional medicine
description: As Covid spreads in North Korea, state media urges the use of traditional medicine against the virus.

title: Royals attend Top Gun: Maverick premiere in London
description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge attend the premiere of the long-awaited Top Gun sequel.

title: Australia election 2022: Cost of living worries voters
description: If interest rates keep rising 300,000 Australians may default on mortgage repayments.

title: Could contact lenses be the ultimate computer screen?
description: Firms are developing smart contact lenses that can project data in front of the user's eye.

title: Everton 3-2 Crystal Palace: One of the greatest nights of my career - Frank Lampard
description: Everton boss Frank Lampard says he feels "very proud" after his side produced an "incredible" comeback to beat Crystal Palace and secure their place in the Premier League next season.

title: More post-fine twists to come over Partygate?
description: The Metropolitan Police have finished investigating, but the political fallout isn't over yet.

title: Twitter steps up Ukraine misinformation fight
description: The social media platform says it will put false claims from official accounts behind warning notices.

title: Will Sue Gray's report into Downing Street parties be damning for Boris Johnson?
description: Our correspondents reveal what they know about the long-awaited report on Covid law-breaking at No 10.

title: Partygate: How did the Metropolitan Police decide who to fine?
description: A total of 83 people have been fined over events in Westminster - but how were the decisions made?

title: Ukrainian widow confronts Russian soldier accused of killing her husband
description: The 21-year-old serviceman has pled guilty to killing her husband in a village in Ukraine's north-east.

title: Russia's laser weapon claim derided as propaganda
description: Moscow says it has destroyed a drone with a laser, but Kyiv says it can't mask battlefield failure.

title: Russian McDonald's buyer to rebrand restaurants
description: The fast food giant says the new owner of its 850 Russian restaurants will operate them under a new brand.

title: Vardy v Rooney: 10 things we learned at the Wagatha Christie libel trial
description: Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy went head-to-head in a high-profile High Court libel case.

title: Extinction: Why scientists are freezing threatened species in 'biobanks'
description: Conservation scientists hope that preserving genetic material offers future insurance against extinction

title: Quiz of the week: What's in the Platinum Jubilee pudding?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on over the past seven days?

title: Royal Mail warns it will put prices up again
description: The company says it has to act to cover higher costs, including wages, energy and fuel expenses.

title: Cornwall pub receives framed apology from Vogue magazine
description: The village pub had been asked to change its name but has now received a framed apology.

title: How countries are responding to the cost of living
description: BBC Newsnight launches its Global Tracker to assess the impact of the cost of living across across the world.

title: Pressure builds on Rishi Sunak to act now on living costs
description: The CBI and the TUC urge the government to help the "hardest hit" as inflation soars.

title: Bobbi-Anne McLeod: Man obsessed with serial killers jailed for murder of Plymouth teen
description: Cody Ackland will serve a minimum of 31 years for the murder of Bobbi-Anne McLeod.

title: Billy Sharp: Fan jailed for headbutting player at end of match
description: Sheffield United captain Billy Sharp was assaulted at the end of their match with Nottingham Forest.

title: Channel 4 News didn't do itself any favours, says Nadine Dorries
description: The culture secretary criticises the channel's news show - but says that is not why she wants to sell it off.

title: Boris Johnson will not face a further Partygate fine, says No 10
description: Police have now ended their investigation into Covid breaches during lockdown parties in No 10.

title: Afghanistan's female TV presenters must cover their faces, say Taliban
description: Women's faces are banned from TV screens as Afghanistan's rulers further tighten restrictions.

title: Rebekah Vardy is 'highly unreliable witness' says Coleen Rooney's lawyer
description: Rebekah Vardy's libel case against Coleen Rooney is on its final day in London's High Court.

title: EuroMillions: Lottery winners scooped £184m with lucky dip ticket
description: Joe and Jess Thwaite, from Gloucester, said the record £184m win will give them "time to dream".

title: George North: Year out allowed Wales back 'to heal mentally and physically'
description: George North admits he did not expect to tour with Wales this summer but says he is getting back to his best after a year-long injury.

title: Canada's indigenous leaders ask for royal apology
description: Prince Charles and Camilla's visit to Canada for the Queen's Platinum Jubilee will end on Thursday.

title: Derry Girls finale hailed as 'a triumph' by critics
description: The finale of the Channel 4 sitcom, which aired on Wednesday, received several five-star reviews.

title: Wales call up uncapped Nathan Broadhead for World Cup play-off and Nations League
description: Wales name uncapped forward Nathan Broadhead in their squad for June's World Cup play-off final and four Nations League games.

title: Sri Lanka defaults on debt for first time in its history
description: The default comes as the country struggles with its worst financial crisis in more than 70 years.

title: Jofra Archer: England pace bowler to miss summer with back injury
description: England fast bowler Jofra Archer will miss the entire season after suffering a stress fracture of the lower back.

title: George W Bush's speech gaffe over 'Iraq invasion'
description: The former US president corrected himself after saying Putin had invaded Iraq rather than Ukraine.

title: Kate stands in for Queen at Buckingham Palace garden party
description: The duchess joins more than 8,000 guests at the second Buckingham Palace garden party of the year.

title: Cost of living: Calls to bring benefit and pension rises forward
description: Big increases are due next April but charities say soaring prices mean people need the money now.

title: I learned to sing using YouTube - and now it's my career
description: A holiday rep who was unable to sing teaches himself then scoops two music awards.

title: Google helps new mum discover postpartum cardiomyopathy
description: Postpartum cardiomyopathy is a rare form of heart failure which is caused by having a child.

title: Spanish Grand Prix: 'Welcome to my world, Lewis!' Fernando Alonso on life in F1
description: His 41st birthday fast approaching, and on the ninth anniversary of his last Formula 1 victory, Fernando Alonso is philosophical about life, career, everything.

title: The Papers: 'Tough times' and 'crime rise fears' over inflation
description: Many of Thursday's papers analyse how soaring inflation will affect people's lives in the UK.

title: US mothers warned against DIY baby formula
description: Desperate mothers are trying to mix their own baby formula, but experts warn of the dangers.

title: Burkina Faso trapped miners: Wives heartbroken but praying for miracles
description: A month after a zinc mine was flooded in Burkina Faso, relatives of those trapped refuse to give up.

title: India seeks to win public trust in crisis-hit Sri Lanka
description: Sri Lanka's giant neighbour is emerging as one of its biggest providers of aid, after years of mistrust.
